page.title: 07Tunstall Farm, Nr. Gt.Ayton
page.content: Tunstall Farm, in the north of our area and bordering the wooded parkland of the Middlesbrough greenbelt, is mostly 150 acres of grassland for cattle ,sheep and the 20 ponies that are used in the riding stables here. People are taught to ride in the riding school, but can also go pony trecking. Though most of the land is under grass, wheat and barley are grown for fodder. One small wood has been demolished and several hedges have recently gone, but some extensive conifer tree planting has taken place along the northern boundary of the farm. The village of Tunstall is now mere humps in a field, most of the houses having been abandoned after enclosures.
